title.narrative: Sexual and Reproductive Health and Rights in Palestine (SRHR) 2021-2024
Sexual and Reproductive Health and Rights in Palestine (SRHR) 2021-2024

description.narrative:
Sverige har beslutat att arbeta mot en mer fokuserad ansats för SRHR i Palestina. Denna ansats har resulterat i att Palestinian Medical Relief Society (PMRS) föreslås implementera ett treårigt program med fokus på förbättrad service och ökade rättigheter vad gäller SRHR i Palestina. De SRHR relaterade behoven i Palestina är uppenbara och Sverige har ett mervärde inom detta område genom sitt engagemang och ledarskap inom områden som kvinnors rätt till reproduktiv hälsa och mödravård sedan 1960-talet, en erfarenhet som kan användas för att stärka SRHR i Palestina. SRHR utgör dessutom en del av Sveriges feministiska utrikespolitik vilket omsätts i handling i och med det föreslagna stödet.
Det föreslagna stödet är presenterat som ett program med en implementeringsperiod om 36 månader med en total budget på 45 miljoner svenska kronor, som kommer att implementeras på Västbanken, i Gaza och i östra Jerusalem. Utöver detta kommer 200 000 SEK att reserveras för att genomföra en granskning av intern styrning och kontroll av PMRS under avtalsperioden.

Sweden has decided to work more towards a focused approach on SRHR in Palestine. This process has led Sweden proposing a program with the Palestinian Medical Relief Society (PMRS) to be implemented over three years, focusing on improving the SRHR services and rights in Palestine. The SRHR gaps and needs in Palestine are evident and Sweden has an added value in this areas as it has been a champion of women's access to reproductive and maternal health services since the 1960's and this experience can be utilized to strengthen SRHR in Palestine. Moreover, Sweden's feminist foreign policy, gives attention to SRHR and this shall be translated into programs and responses to on the ground.
The proposed support is submitted in the frame of a program with an implementation period of 36 months with a total budget of 45 million Swedish kroner and will cover the West Bank, Gaza and East Jerusalem. This is in addition to SEK 200 000 to conduct an internal control review of PMRS to assess the organization's internal capacities.

The proposed program will be implemented by PMRS and will have the following goals:
1- Palestinians, women & men, girls and boys, without discrimination, have access to quality primary comprehensive health care focusing on SRHR and Mental Health and Psychosocial services (MHPSS) service and support delivery.
2- Mobilized and empowered local communities advocating for their SRHR rights with emphasis on youth, women and marginalized groups.
3- A resilient Palestinian civil society has been strengthened.

tag.narrative: 3.1 - By 2030, reduce the global maternal mortality ratio to less than 70 per 100,000 live births.
3.1 - Till 2030 minska mödradödligheten i världen till mindre än 70 dödsfall per 100 000 förlossningar med levande barn.

5.6 - Ensure universal access to sexual and reproductive health and reproductive rights as agreed in accordance with the Programme of Action of the International Conference on Population and Development and the Beijing Platform for Action and the outcome documents of their review conferences.

5.6 - Säkerställa allmän tillgång till sexuell och reproduktiv hälsa och reproduktiva rättigheter i enlighet med överenskommelserna i handlingsprogrammet från den internationella konferensen om befolkning och utveckling, Pekingplattformen samt slutdokumenten från respektive översynskonferenser.

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative:
The intervention objectives have the following outcomes:
1- All Palestinians without discrimination have access to comprehensive quality curative and preventive primary health care services through permanent clinics and outreach activities in our targeted area with a special focus on scaling MHPSS and SRHR services.
2- PMRS and targeted Palestinians are ready to respond to emergency situations, including chronic emergency.
3- People in the 400 targeted communities are actively demanding their rights with focus on health, SRHR, healthy environments and education.
4- More women are demanding their rights with a focus on SRHR.
5- PMRS is an efficient and more sustainable organization with more capacities on SRHR.
6- Stronger presence and visibility of Community Based Organizations (CBOs).
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
